subject: Communication
title: Gestures That Don't Translate
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Gestures That Don't Translate.

hook.text: The thumbs-up means 'great' in America. In parts of the Middle East, it's an obscene insult.

buildup.text: The OK sign, peace sign, and head wobble all mean completely different things across cultures.

discovery.text: While basic facial expressions are universal, hand gestures and emblems are culturally learned and highly variable.

twist.text: Even nodding and shaking your head aren't universal â€” Bulgarian nodding means 'no,' not 'yes.'

climax.text: International business training now includes gesture guides because one wrong sign can sabotage a deal.

punchline.text: Your favorite gesture might be someone else's worst insult.

quiz.question: Are hand gestures universal across cultures?
options: No, many gestures have different meanings across cultures
